We're calling on ALL music festivals, venues, and promoters to make a clear commitment to not use #facialrecognition technology on fans, now or in the future.

Check to see where festivals stand, and email the ones that haven't made a commitment yet here: https://t.co/qhPRP7cS6r

Allowing fans to “opt out” of #facialrecognition doesn’t fix the problems inherent in the technology. Many fans might not be aware of the risks involved with opting in, and others may feel uncomfortable opting out for fear that it could subject them to additional screening.

.@LiveNation says they may use #facialrecognition in the future, but tries to assuage fears by saying it would only be on an "opt in" basis.

This is the same BS talking point we hear from the airline industry who are rolling out biometric boarding programs.

Some companies like @Ticketmaster / @LiveNation have invested in #facialrecognition technology in the past. 

After our campaign launched, @LiveNation confirmed they have no *current* plans to use this technology, which is a positive step

But troublingly, they left the door open

Experts compare #FacialRecognition to nuclear and biological weapons. https://t.co/tMGzWK5JRq

It's a uniquely dangerous form of surveillance technology. https://t.co/LzDIgTVuOg

Dozens of organizations from across the political spectrum have called for it to be banned. https://t.co/aNE4fVfx70

Others, like @sxsw @pitchforkfest @EDC_LasVegas @ultra and @RiotFest did not respond to multiple requests to clarify their policies and plans regarding the use of #facialrecognition, sparking concern among fans that they may be planning to employ invasive biometric surveillance.

Major festivals like @Bonnaroo @Electric_Forest @aclfestival @shambhala_mf @PunkRockBowling @LucidityFest @uscevents (Paradiso)  and @SummerMeltdown made clear commitments to not experiment on fans with #facialrecognition technology.

Press release here: https://t.co/7EHH6gUg0R

NEW: We just launched a scorecard showing where major music festivals stand when it comes to using invasive and racially biased #facialrecognition technology on fans. 

Find out if your favorite event might be doing this here: https://t.co/37G3wR1Esl https://t.co/7b0o9Fohym
